content:
Excellent approach! It's always a good idea to take stock of what you already have at home before heading out to buy more. You can save time and money by using up what you already have on hand.

Since you mentioned you bought essentials from Costco last month, you might have some pantry staples that can be used for this dinner party. Here are some items that might still be useful:

* Meat: If you have any frozen meat like ground beef, chicken breasts, or steaks, you can use those for the main course.
* Canned goods: Canned tomatoes, beans, or vegetables can be used in a variety of dishes, including the main course or as a side.
* Spices and seasonings: If you have a well-stocked spice rack, you might already have the necessary seasonings for the dishes on the menu.
* Baking supplies: If you have flour, sugar, and other baking essentials, you can whip up some delicious desserts.
* Beverages: You might still have some wine, champagne, or soft drinks left over from last month's gathering.

Take stock of what you have and adjust your grocery list accordingly. You can also consider using up any leftover items to reduce food waste and save money.

Remember to also check the expiration dates of any perishable items you plan to use, especially meats and dairy products. You want to make sure everything is fresh and safe to serve to your guests.

How's that? Are there any other questions or concerns you have about the menu or grocery list?
